rev.comment: rv: The BBC link is an interesting piece no matter what Ennis says about it - discuss before removing; also: your link appears to be to a commercial vendor
The BBC "study" was supposed to be a replication of Ennis' work, but she insists that it wasn't, that it was conducted by an inadequately trained medical technologist, and has major flaws.
This meta-analysis is widely recognized as non-rigorous with very serious flaws and incorrect statistics. What objective source considers it otherwise?
rv, your personal interview is not a reliable source
I personally interviewed Prof. Ennis...her statement is at: http://homeopathic.com/articles/media/index.php
Rv. No one in the media has published enis's claims. There is a reason for this.
The BBC "study" was supposed to be a replication of Ennis' work, but she insists that it wasn't, that it was conducted by an inadequately trained medical technologist, and has major flaws.

Rv addition of spam link and removal of a source.

It is inappropriate to reference a BBC "science" experiment that was never published, especially when the researcher said that he was replicating Dr. M. Ennis' study, but Ennis asserts this isn't true
taking the "leaps and bounds" out of the quote. Lets not be too extravagent.
The BBC "study" was supposed to be a replication of Ennis' work, but she insists that it wasn't, that it was conducted by an inadequately trained medical technologist, and has major flaws.
This meta-analysis is widely recognized as non-rigorous.
not theory of infinitesimals a METHOD: minimum dose
there is no theory of infinitesimals, it is a method: the minimum dose
Pure linkspam; needs removal, not relabeling.
clarify controversial nature of homeopathic RCTs
making this sentence a grammatical sentence and removing a quote that didn't fit, and how I am loathe to ask for citation in a sentence with too many citations and quotes... but it needs one.

Rv. Not all at once obviously, repeated 1:10 dilutions add up.
/* The 'Law of Similars' */ Let's get it right. A thousand x billion x billion = THOUSANDS of CUBIC KILOMETERS of water! Geez!
Rv. That's just what they do...
/* The 'Law of Similars' */ "do not contain any" -> "only very minute traces". One cc of typical liquid contains 10^22 molecules. You'd have to dilute a thousand x billion x billion times to zero it
